meanings.definition: To defeat decisively in a competition or conflict.
meanings.sent1: The team was trouncing their opponents in the soccer match.
meanings.sent2: The boxer trounced his rival in the ring with powerful punches.
meanings.sent3: The cat trouncing the mouse in a game of chase was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The storm trounced the coastal town, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The student trouncing the difficult math problem felt a sense of accomplishment.

meanings.definition: A decisive defeat in a competition or conflict.
meanings.sent1: The trouncing of the home team was unexpected by the fans.
meanings.sent2: The election result was a trouncing for the incumbent mayor.
meanings.sent3: The trouncing of the video game boss brought cheers from the players.
meanings.sent4: The trouncing of the chess champion by a newcomer shocked the spectators.
meanings.sent5: The trouncing of the debate opponent left the candidate speechless.
